actions.text: Read second time and referred to Senate Committee on Finance.
Committee on Finance requested executive comment from OMB; Treasury Department; Health and Human Services Department.

official_title: A bill to provide that automatic cost-of-living increases under the Social Security Act, and under certain Federal retirement programs which are linked to the Social Security Act, shall be made on October 1 of each year, rather than July 1.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act and the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974 to provide that automatic cost-of-living increases in social security and Federal retirement benefits shall be made on October 1 of each year for calendar years after 1981 (currently automatic cost-of-living increases are made on July 1 of each year).

titles.title: A bill to provide that automatic cost-of-living increases under the Social Security Act, and under certain Federal retirement programs which are linked to the Social Security Act, shall be made on October 1 of each year, rather than July 1.
